<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/02/jobs-report-shows-labor-market-growth-slowing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So How Was the September Jobs Report?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Not great, Bob gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=367 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/7yoAIR7CdWOUE/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Not great, Bob gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/7yoAIR7CdWOUE/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy / Mad Men</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. economy <a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-us-news-economy-bda32f552bd450be2b804131cd5d49e6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added 661,000 jobs</a> last month, and the unemployment rate dipped to 7.9% from 8.4% in August.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it means: </strong>The rate of the recovery in the labor market is slowing down. This was the first jobs report since April that showed net hiring below 1 million new jobs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The slowdown is not exactly a surprise. Economists know the unemployment rate is a lot like your gym routine—easily knocked off track and sluggish to return to full strength. Take these stats, for example: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>More than half of the jobs lost in March-April have now been recovered, but that means there are still </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/10/02/labor-market-gained-661000-september-economic-recovery-slowed/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10.7 million fewer people</a></span><span> with jobs than before the pandemic.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At the current rate, it would take 16 months to recoup all those jobs...but as we just mentioned, the hiring pace is slowing down. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This jobs report capped off a week in which <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-30/disney-shell-cuts-mark-warning-sign-for-global-economic-rebound?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big corporate names</a> announced drastic reductions to their workforces:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disney cut 28,000 workers at its slumping resorts.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>United and American Airlines began to furlough 32,000 employees after stimulus discussions stalled.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Other blue-chip companies, including Allstate and Goldman Sachs, also announced layoffs.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These moves show that the coronavirus is still crimping growth nearly seven months after initial shutdowns. With most of the emergency aid from March spent by now, businesses will increasingly look to the government to ensure the recovery doesn’t completely stall out.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STOCKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/02/stocks-dont-drop-much-feared-president-trump-tests-positive-covid19?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stocks Drop, Stop, Then Roll
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When President Trump <a href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1311892190680014849?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> that he and Melania had tested positive for COVID-19 the world nervously eyed the financial markets to see how they would react. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It was ugly, initially</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Early Friday morning, U.S. stock futures, which often show how the market will move before it opens, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/02/investing/global-stocks/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why? Investors don’t like uncertainty, and even though First Lady Melania Trump said she and her husband were feeling good, no one knew how severe the president’s illness was. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as the shock of the news faded, the market began to recover after the White House said President Trump was experiencing <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/10/02/trump-covid-19-updates-president-melania-trump-hicks-test-positive/3549616001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mild symptoms</a> and felt “energetic.” The Dow and S&P 500 finished the day with only marginal losses. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The mini-rebound was also fueled by comments made by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, who signaled a standalone House bill <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/sarahhansen/2020/10/02/airlines-could-see-more-relief-ahead-of-stimulus-deal-pelosi-says/#30878b05518d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">providing aid</a> for struggling airlines could be coming soon. Whether it’s part of a broader relief package or not is unclear, since Republicans and Democrats remain <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/02/coronavirus-stimulus-trump-positive-test-changes-dynamic-pelosi-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">far apart</a> on the size and scope of the relief efforts. But Pelosi said yesterday there was reason for optimism.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Trump’s health introduces a huge layer of uncertainty into what was already a volatile election cycle.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/02/facebook-pushes-back-criticisms-made-netflix-documentary-social-dilemma?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook Hands Out a 10% on the Tomatometer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Teenager looking at phone " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNjMzL3NvY2lhbF9kaWxlbW1hLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Netflix</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For most people, the hardest part of watching the Netflix documentary <em>The Social Dilemma </em>is fighting off the urge to check the very platforms the doc is criticizing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For Facebook, the stakes were higher. </strong>The company responded to the documentary yesterday in a <a href="https://about.fb.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/What-The-Social-Dilemma-Gets-Wrong.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blog post</a>, arguing the film “gives a distorted view of how social media platforms work to create a convenient scapegoat for what are difficult and complex societal problems.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The post rebutted claims made by <em>The Social Dilemma </em>that 1) its users are the product, 2) the platform helps spread misinformation, and 3) its algorithms are sinister in any way.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why is Zuck doing movie reviews?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>The Social Dilemma</em>, which was among Netflix's top 10 most-watched shows in September, attacks social media companies for irresponsibly manipulating their users. Facebook is also <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/02/facebook-rebuts-the-social-dilemma-popular-netflix-documentary.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">implicated</a> by the documentary for its role in election interference, ethnic violence, and increased rates of depression and suicide.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> With lawmakers circling, FB is trying to win in the court of public opinion...one strongly-worded blog post at a time. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/02/ubers-freight-arm-valued-500-billion-new-investment?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber’s Freight Arm Rai—
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Long-haul trucks" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNjIzL2xvbmctaGF1bF90cnVja3MuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sorry, gonna have to stop you mid-headline. Uber has a freight arm? Yes? Okay, go on.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Uber said it received a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-sells-stake-in-freight-unit-to-private-investors-11601632800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$500 million investment</a> in its freight business from Greenbriar Equity Group. The unit is now worth a meaty $3.3 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But what does it do? </strong>Uber Freight acts as a digital brokerage that connects shippers and long-haul truckers in the deeply fragmented world of logistics. It’s not a huge part of Uber’s overall business, but at 9.4% of the company’s total revenue, it’s not peanuts.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Plus, it’s growing (+27% annually last quarter) at a time when Uber’s ride-sharing bookings have shrunk due to the pandemic. The company’s other fast-growing unit, Uber Eats, is </span><span><a href="https://qz.com/1889602/uber-q2-2020-earnings-eats-is-now-bigger-than-rides/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now bigger</a></span><span> than Rides.    </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>this investment allows Uber Freight to extend its runway “indefinitely,” according to <a href="https://www.freightwaves.com/news/breaking-news-uber-freight-raises-500m-from-greenbriar-equity-group?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Freight Waves</a>, as well as implement new tech and expand into new markets.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F10%2F02%2Fubers-freight-arm-valued-500-billion-new-investment" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the past few months, schools that had been shut down due to Covid-19 have cautiously reopened for in-person instruction. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We put together a photo gallery of fascinating pandemic-era school scenes in 13 different countries. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/02/photos-students-return-school-13-countries-coronavirus-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Saturday conversation starters:</strong></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SATURDAY HEADLINES
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We all know that bird is the word, but sometimes words about birds aren't quite true. Three of these avian-themed headlines are legit, while one isn't real. Can you spot the fake?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Do crows possess a </span><span><a href="https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/do-crows-possess-form-consciousness-180975940/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">form of consciousness</a></span><span>?”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Parrots were removed from a UK safari park after </span><span><a href="https://www.insider.com/foul-fowl-language-2020-9?utmSource=twitter&utmContent=referral&utmTerm=topbar&referrer=twitter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">teaching each other to swear</a></span><span> and then laughing about it”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Cheating birds </span><span><a href="https://phys.org/news/2020-10-birds-mimic-host-nestlings-foster.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mimic host nestlings</a></span><span> to deceive foster parents”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Swans with brains 1/300 the size of orangutans’ </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/WT3AtwkiBosG673AdK/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pass the same IQ test</a></span><span>”</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

SHARE THE BREW
</h3>

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">

Report?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Not great, Bob gif\" style=\"display: block; style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy / Mad Men\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. economy \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-us-news-economy-bda32f552bd450be2b804131cd5d49e6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded 661,000 jobs\u003c/a\u003e last month, and the unemployment rate dipped to 7.9% from 8.4% in August.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it means: \u003c/strong\u003eThe rate of the recovery in the labor market is slowing down. This was the first jobs report since April that showed net hiring below 1 million new jobs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe slowdown is not exactly a surprise. Economists know the unemployment rate is a lot like your gym routine—easily knocked off track and sluggish to return to full strength. Take these stats, for example: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMore than half of the jobs lost in March-April have now been recovered, but that means there are still \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/10/02/labor-market-gained-661000-september-economic-recovery-slowed/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10.7 million fewer people\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with jobs than before the pandemic.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt the current rate, it would take 16 months to recoup all those jobs...but as we just mentioned, the hiring pace is slowing down. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis jobs report capped off a week in which \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-30/disney-shell-cuts-mark-warning-sign-for-global-economic-rebound?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebig corporate names\u003c/a\u003e announced drastic reductions to their workforces:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDisney cut 28,000 workers at its slumping resorts.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnited and American Airlines began to furlough 32,000 employees after stimulus discussions stalled.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOther blue-chip companies, including Allstate and Goldman Sachs, also announced layoffs.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese moves show that the coronavirus is still crimping growth nearly seven months after initial shutdowns. With most of the emergency aid from March spent by now, businesses will increasingly look to the government to ensure the recovery doesn’t completely stall out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Roll\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1311892190680014849?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e that he and Melania had tested positive for COVID-19 the world nervously eyed the financial markets to see how they would react. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt was ugly, initially\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarly Friday morning, U.S. stock futures, which often show how the market will move before it opens, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/02/investing/global-stocks/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhy? Investors don’t like uncertainty, and even though First Lady Melania Trump said she and her husband were feeling good, no one knew how severe the president’s illness was. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as the shock of the news faded, the market began to recover after the White House said President Trump was experiencing \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/10/02/trump-covid-19-updates-president-melania-trump-hicks-test-positive/3549616001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emild symptoms\u003c/a\u003e and felt “energetic.” The Dow and S\u0026P 500 finished the day with only marginal losses. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe mini-rebound was also fueled by comments made by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, who signaled a standalone House bill \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/sarahhansen/2020/10/02/airlines-could-see-more-relief-ahead-of-stimulus-deal-pelosi-says/#30878b05518d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproviding aid\u003c/a\u003e for struggling airlines could be coming soon. Whether it’s part of a broader relief package or not is unclear, since Republicans and Democrats remain \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/02/coronavirus-stimulus-trump-positive-test-changes-dynamic-pelosi-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efar apart\u003c/a\u003e on the size and scope of the relief efforts. But Pelosi said yesterday there was reason for optimism.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eTrump’s health introduces a huge layer of uncertainty into what was already a volatile election cycle.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor most people, the hardest part of watching the Netflix documentary \u003cem\u003eThe Social Dilemma \u003c/em\u003eis fighting off the urge to check the very platforms the doc is criticizing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor Facebook, the stakes were higher. \u003c/strong\u003eThe company responded to the documentary yesterday in a \u003ca href=\"https://about.fb.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/What-The-Social-Dilemma-Gets-Wrong.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblog post\u003c/a\u003e, arguing the film “gives a distorted view of how social media platforms work to create a convenient scapegoat for what are difficult and complex societal problems.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe post rebutted claims made by \u003cem\u003eThe Social Dilemma \u003c/em\u003ethat 1) its users are the product, 2) the platform helps spread misinformation, and 3) its algorithms are sinister in any way.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy is Zuck doing movie reviews?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Social Dilemma\u003c/em\u003e, which was among Netflix's top 10 most-watched shows in September, attacks social media companies for irresponsibly manipulating their users. Facebook is also \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/02/facebook-rebuts-the-social-dilemma-popular-netflix-documentary.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eimplicated\u003c/a\u003e by the documentary for its role in election interference, ethnic violence, and increased rates of depression and suicide.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e With lawmakers circling, FB is trying to win in the court of public opinion...one strongly-worded blog post at a time. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Okay, go on.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Uber said it received a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-sells-stake-in-freight-unit-to-private-investors-11601632800?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$500 million investment\u003c/a\u003e in its freight business from Greenbriar Equity Group. The unit is now worth a meaty $3.3 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut what does it do? \u003c/strong\u003eUber Freight acts as a digital brokerage that connects shippers and long-haul truckers in the deeply fragmented world of logistics. It’s not a huge part of Uber’s overall business, but at 9.4% of the company’s total revenue, it’s not peanuts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePlus, it’s growing (+27% annually last quarter) at a time when Uber’s ride-sharing bookings have shrunk due to the pandemic.
